item.description:
NEW HAMPSHIRE SERIES:
Mt. Garfield, Mt. Galehead, North Twin Mountain and South Twin Mountain

EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran. Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 281-5882. FINISH YOUR NH 48 4,000 LIST WITH US!


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS

Difficulty: 15.0 miles, 5,477' ASL climb; at a 1.25-1.5 mile / hour pace this is between an 10- to 12-hour hike.

CLICK HERE: Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the Haystack Road (Forest Road 304), North Twin Trailhead (CAR SPOT -- ALL HIKERS DRIVE HERE FIRST); then to the Garfield Trailhead on the Gale River Loop Road, off of U.S. Route 3 (between I-93 and U.S. 302), Twin Mountain, NH.

Car Spot Time: 7 a.m.

Trailhead Time: 7:20 a.m.


A view of Mt. Garfield, as seen from the summit of Bondcliff



TRIP SUMMARY / UPDATES (08/23/2010 5:30 p.m.): This trip is a rescheduled event from last month when I was unable to hike on that day -- sorry about that, trying once again! -- cross-posted event with a trip scheduled with the New England Hiking Meetup (NEHM) and Hiking Mates CHALLENGE (HMC). This time my assistant organizer Jeff and I will try to find camping at the meetup location along Haystack Mountain Road, if possible -- if you'd like to join me just shoot me an email. NOTE: This is a dog-friendly hike (i.e., Mike is coming!). NOTE: This is a dog-friendly hike (i.e., Mike is coming!).

TRAILS OVERVIEW: This hike begins on the Garfield Trail that generally follows the old access road to the former Mount Garfield fire lookout. Grades here are moderate except for the last steep ascent to the Mount Garfield, our first peak where there are great views all around. Galehead Mountain is then accessed by the AT via the Garfield Ridge Trail. The Twins are accessed via Twinway; we'll leave the ridge via the North Twin Spur to North Twin Mountain, then down the North Twin Trail. The spur trail features moderate grade changes with a few minor scrambles mixed in. The North Twin Trail runs from the seasonal Forest Service Haystack Road to near the summit of North Twin Mountain. The first half is mostly on an old logging railroad grade with some serious brook crossings, while the remainder climbs more steeply to the summit.

Despite its name, the Little River is wide enough that it can be hard to find a place to rock-hop all the way across; a fellow group member reports that there is a very well defined herd path that avoids the river crossings on the North Twin Trail. There is a bridge at the parking lot where hikers can judge the size of the river, however.


The AMC Galehead Hut, with North Twin Mountain riding in the background



ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, sunscreen, bug repellent. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; trekking poles will be helpful gear for this hike.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

CLICK HERE FOR A TRIP PLANNER OF THE HIKE ROUTE -- PRINT AND TAKE A COPY WITH YOU.


AREA OVERVIEW

TRAIL DESCRIPTIONS AND TRIP REPORTS
Link, Area Overview

Link, Trail Description - Garfield Trail
Link, Trail Description - The Twinway that connects the Garfield Ridge Trail with South Twin Mountain
Link, Trail Description - The North Twin Spir Trail that connects The Twins peaks
Link, Trail Description - the North Twin Trail that Leads from North Twin Mountain to the Haystack Mountain Road trailhead

Link, Up-To-Date Trail Conditions

The South Twin Mountain Summit



NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
